text: starting to actually get burned by the main/master debacle.  had no clue what was happening on some repos, everything seemed to be refusing to pull to latest commits.  But no, the branch had switched.  sigh.

text: Haven’t ran across this yet, but I know I definitely will at one point when I try to pull `master` and it’ll fail, and I’ll be confused for a few minutes

text: it's incredibly obnoxious.  The whole world now no longer has a standard name for a main/master branch of a git repo due to the pathologies of american politics.  It would be hilarious if it weren't really irritating me right now

text: This is basically solved by git completion... `git checkout m<tab>`

text:
Make a symlink:
`git symbolic-ref refs/heads/main refs/heads/master`
makes `main` be a symlink to `master`
